intro: Ouratea afzelii, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its dense, white or pale green foliage that gives it a misty appearance. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink, adding ornamental value to gardens. Ouratea afzelii is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
